Reviews.Title: “simply great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arik B
Reviews.Content: I've spent three nights in this comfortable and nice hotel for a work holiday and I found it perfect for me. The hotel is small, 10 rooms, but it has all what you need. The bathroom and the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and they answer to you to every question you have, helping you to find the right bus to go wherever or a nice restaurant or just a fast tasty pizza. The area is the best in Rome: Trastevere. It's THE area, but the Carmel Hotel is in a small street, so you can just enjoy Rome without the noise of the center.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Micol B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small hotel for 3 nights. It has no frills but it's charming and very well located in the heart of trastevere. The staff was very helpful and gave us suggestions on local restaurants and bar. The rooms are nice and clean ,we had a room that opened to the beautiful terrace. I would definetely come back next time I'm in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emzzharris
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place in central Rome. We stayed here for a few days while travelling in Rome. The Staff and owners we very friendly making us feel like home. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and there was great room service. It was a great price for central Rome. We had a wonderful time here and would definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elliot H
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights in this wonderful hotel can hardly recommend a better, more comfortable place in Rome than this! The location is good, the facilities are very good and the service is personal and great!! All the amenities are modern and most important of all, the hotel is spotless! On two nights we had to stay in for dinner. The restaurant is also great, with good choice and, again, great service. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice cetnrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lukasz W
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this place for 3 nights. Resonable price for the central location. Close to the church Santa Maria in Trastevere, easy access to public transportation. Friedly staff, family atmospere, clean and quiet. Breakfast was served in the coffee bar next to the hotel with a coupon that I received from the hotel. It was better than I could have imagined, making it an extraordinary value for the price in that location! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: HS07
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel in the lovely area of Trastevere, an area with great restaurants and also close to the main sites. The service at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The terrace room was wonderful and clean and we felt like we had the the terrace area outside all to ourselves! Good value for money and great hotel overall!

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: central i
Reviews.Content: my wife and i went for a five day getaway to rome and were very lucky to find pensione carmel. this hotel offers a very nice accommodation and is perfectly located and cheaply priced, especially compared to what it offers. the staff is kind and helpful. next time in rome, my wife and i will come back!

Reviews.Title: “The Carmel made my stay in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: AdrianMolk
Reviews.Content: The quaint hotel with its service orientated staff and homely atmosphere contributed to my memorable stay in Rome. It was my second time at the establishment and I do know that I have found my place in gorgeous neighborhood of Trastevere, Roma. Highly recommended folks! On the first visit, I was staying near the Termini station and I went for a long stroll in the Tratevere quarter. I could not believe what a tactical error I had made with regard to my accommodation and I in turn started to search for a possible alternative. The magic of Trastevere's streets led me on a journey and then, out of nowhere, I stumbled across the Carmel Hotel. I knew once I walked in and made eye contact with the lovely girl named Tamar, who was stationed in the lobby, that I had found my home away from home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel i Rome”
Reviews.Author: Roger P
Reviews.Content: No luxury but a nice and friendly hotel in Trastevere

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TheDoovoos
Reviews.Content: I've had the chance to be there several times with friends of mine. You often look for a place to stay which is not far from the center, so Carmel Hotel was THE perfect solution, other than the fact that it was very comfortable to be there with the service they gave. On one hand Carmel Hotel is not directly ON Trastevere, but it's a 5min walking distance, so it's amazing!!! Good job guys! Another very important point is the question if it is clean or not. Carmel Hotel DEFINITELY is! See you next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel!! Definitely will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Katarina M
Reviews.Content: A nice family hotel in a very good neighborhood. The room was cozy and clean, the hotel staff was very friendly. It is situated in Trastevere zone, which is full of nice restaurants, near all touristic attractions, in one word - great place to stay. A good value for the price. I will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: ““Reasonable hotel in a good location””
Reviews.Author: emx88
Reviews.Content: We returned to Rome three and one half years after our previous visit and stayed for the third time at the Hotel Carmel. This time we went off-season and the price was even more reasonable. For our purposes the location was very favorable. We again booked the same larger room, #5, opening to the terrace, this time at no additional cost. The price did not include breakfast, but the Café Mameli was being renovated anyway. It is now a non-smoking hotel, an improvement over our first visit. The new electric heater with a fan over the door was an improvement over the old hot water radiator and an electric kettle, cups, saucers plus tea bags and instant coffee were a welcome addition. Our main complaint was that the "hot water" ran at best lukewarm at any time of the day. Some of the employees at the reception were friendly and helpful, others not so much. We spent about 10 days in Rome and walked almost everywhere from the hotel. The Gianicolo, a hill with statues of Garibaldi, his wife and followers, was very close by and was the start of a walk to St. Peter's Square. The botanical garden, more interesting in spring than in fall, was also nearby, as well as the Villa Farnesina and Palazzo Corsini Gallery. We walked to most of our other destinations and took public transportation the rest of the time. We bought food at the Billa supermarket (at the location of the Standa) which was well within walking distance. There was a refrigerator in the room and a TV set with a flat screen, but the programming was almost all in Italian, with movies generally dubbed into Italian. There was a laundromat conveniently located a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quite Hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: Akifumi T
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hotel Carmel for 3 nights during my last business trip on December 2011. It's clean, quite, and the staff very polite. The hotel is located in the heart of Tristeavere, where you can visit many interesting place, eat in the best restaurants and hosteria in Rome. There works a very nice guy (I don't remember his name) who geave us good soggestions about places to visit and traditional restaurant. Good price, and suggestive view from an amazing terrace, that reminded me the traditional Italian inns described by travelers and writers of the eighteenth century.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: tanyael
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in December in this hotel. It has an amazing quality-price ratio, given the fact that is in the very center of Rome, few minutes walk from one of the best areas of the City. Staff has been kind and helpful, the rooms were cozy and comfy and very clean as well. Loved the terrace as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johny F
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel last month. Exceptionally friendly staff and very well located. The staff could not do more for us. They were all very knowledgable and obliging. I have already booked to come back in the summer. The bedrooms were tastefully decorated and the breakfast was outstanding... It was a small charming hotel with a lot of appeal to it. Very clean and I would recommend it to everyone, excellent value for money also.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: tamar M
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience, I've stayed in the Hotel Carmel for 4 nights and 5 days and I found a very nice and polite, English speaker stuff, which we all know in Italy it's not so easy. The hotel is exactly in the center of Rome, closed to all the nice things we all like to visit in Rome and in the best area of the restaurants, bars and pubs. I've really had a positive experience, and the price wasn't bad at all

Reviews.Title: “V good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel B
Reviews.Content: Wonderful position in the centre of Rome with good connections all over the city, friendly staff, we founded a very clean and nice room (not small at all). As price / quality / position i think coulndt find better. We will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable hotel with terras!”
Reviews.Author: Hoi-Lau
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Carmel Hotel for 3 days. Friendly english speaking staff, clean room and bathroom. Ans there is a big terrace, nice tocooldown after a whole day in the chaotic city of Rome. The hotel is located in sparkling Trastevere, near the Tiber riverside ans lots of nice restaurants and bars. The price quality rate is very good, even cheap for Rome. A good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “very good location, reasonable price, but dirty cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: skunkx
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days here with a toddler, and our room was very dusty, the floor was sticky with cleaning products, and everything bore a heavy smell of smoke that I couldn't get rid of even after having slept with the window open for two nights in a row. We had an electric water boiler (which didn't work, but I complained, and the staff changed it at once) and some complimentary instant coffee (nestlé, sadly), tea and sugar, a fridge, and some soap. The bed was made daily and the used towels were replaced daily, but anything else stayed dirty during our whole stay (bed cover included). Our room was very small, and the furniture was minimal. A very poor hotel so far. On the other hand, it is true that its location at the border between trastevere and monteverde is a great one, and also, there is a typical roman 'terrazza' on the first floor where clients can receive guests in a relaxed (if not comfortable) setting. And considering the average prices in rome, this hotel has a reasonable price/quality ratio. So, all in all, I would recommend it if you plan to spend but a very little time in your room, and if you are not traveling with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel despite the good location.”
Reviews.Author: Naim00
Reviews.Content: Positive: Location in Trasvetere & the nice balcony patio where one can sip a coffee or beer or whatever it is... Where to get the coffee is a different story since the coffee makers in the room are disgusting. Negatives: 1. Internet only works on the stairs :) in the room is so erratic that don't even try to do it Had to sit on the stairs to access the internet. 2. The hotel is wall to wall with the street cleaning department. So the window view is over the street and the fleet of street cleaners! 3. The room are tiny and the beds even tinnier. We were 2 guy friends and the beds are minuscules and stuck next to each other. Not to mention how uncomfortable they are and how "probably dirty" the cover is! 4. The fridge in the room does NOT work. 5. The Shampoo and soap they provide are just disguting. Probably the poorest quality ever. 6. The room is so small you can't even move. 7. Hot water only in the shower not in the sink. We had to shave using cold water. And the list goes on. In summary bad hotel to avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: xoannieox
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel as the first bed and breakfast we booked was more like a hostel. This hotel was brilliant we had a key for the outside door so didnt feel pressured to get back early. The room was on the small side but comfy!! There was hot running water and comfy beds, The room was cleaned daily and we was giving fresh towels to use. The bathroom was also clean and worked well no problems with leaks or anything like that. THe staff were helpful and friendly and always seemed to be someone there. We loved using the terrace to sit out at night and drink which was lovely. If i went back to rome i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Mala”
Reviews.Author: BMJPAUSA
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night in Rome after spending three nights at the River Palace then going to the Amalfi Coast and Capri. This place is clean and convenient. This place is small and creepy. My beloved took one look and suggested we go the airport and sleep in the lounge waiting for our plane the next day. Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in a young and live Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Crazy_abt_travelling
Reviews.Content: During spring take the room on the terrace, it has sun almost all day and beautiful flowers. I recommend it for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Italpazzo
Reviews.Content: My wife, I, and our five-year-old son have been staying at the Hotel Carmel for years. My wife and I are academics who do research in Rome. I have been doing work in Rome since 1983. So we have a reasonably good idea of options in the city. The location is great; the people who run the hotel are competent, friendly, and helpful; the prices are competitive; the rooms are clean and comfortable; there is a beautiful little terrace; the hotel is constantly being upgraded; and the bar next door, which offers a reasonable "tourist" breakfast in conjunction with the hotel, is extremely welcoming. The days of inexpensive but pleasant "pensioni" in Rome are pretty much if not entirely over. (In 1983, I stayed in one for $8 Canadian a night; it is now a hotel that costs 130 euros per night!) Hotel Carmel is not a five or four star hotel, nor does it pretend to be. But if offers the best price/quality/location combination for old pensione dwellers such as myself that I have been able to find. I/We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “AWLFUL !!”
Reviews.Author: theitaliantraveler
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay at this hotel for four nights...and found after the first night there was no hot water and no one to complain to (other than the algerian cleaning staff that spoke no english or italian). We left after one night and were charged for the full four night stay. We are now in the long process of disputing the charge and attempting to get back $1000 of money charged to our account. We tried to resolve our dispute with this merchant by calling, sending an email in both english and italian, calling again and told to call back after 9 pm, calling after 9 and being told to call a person only available on Fridays....really this is ridiculous. DO NOT STAY HERE>>>>> There are much better options in Trastevere with decent accommodations and respectful operators. The Mechini's from NJ

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Basic but comfortable. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Huffmeister
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carmel was great for what we needed, i.e. a cheap but comfortable and clean place to rest our heads. Our double room was adequate size, as was the bathroom (shower, basin, toilet) which we shared with one other twin room. It's not a five star luxury affair but you won't spend much time in the Hotel as there's so much to see and do in Rome! Beds were made up every day and towels were changed every other day. We overlooked the sun terrace but it was too cold to take advantage of it. The lounge filled conservatory was comfortable but it is the access route to a few rooms so in high season it may become a bit of a thoroughfare. The one night we were going to stay in with a bottle of wine it was being used by a choir group so we had to go out (no hardship!). The point being that you can't 'book' it for your own use. Its location is great, a 10 min walk from the main bars and restaurants in Trastevere so not far to walk back after a night out. It's about 30 mins walk from the main attractions over the river which isn't a problem so long as you bring trainers. A walk in the sunshine is a great way to see the hidden gems of the city. Having seen some of the other areas in Rome we were glad to stay in Hotel Carmel as you get away from some of the more obvious tourist areas that are noisy and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price but unconfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: benZurich
Reviews.Content: This is a great location bed and breakfast for a good price. It offers a kosher breakfast, however it was nothing special, so we were better off going to a bakery and buying our own breakfast. The staff was very friendly, the rooms and bathroom were clean but small. The only unconvinience was that the bed was very very unconfortable- at least in room number 2. we had backache and tusik pain every day.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, small, and not all that clean!”
Reviews.Author: tampatennisplayer
Reviews.Content: I'm a solo traveller who stayed at the Carmel in Sept. 2005. The single room was tiny and next to the stairwell so I heard clanking at odd hours. I was right next to the roof garden which had very little in the way of "garden' but did have various items of stained furniture and some plastic chairs and a table. The bathroom was small and old-looking, as was the room. So the whole impression was sort of seedy. Location is good -- Trastevere is a great section of Rome. Breakfast next door is good -- but you have to ask for more than the toast and they'll give you a pastry. The staff (just a desk clerk) was okay but not given to volunteering any advice or help. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic accomodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: PeterCrampton
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel fairly late and paid 110 Euros/night for what they called a "large"room. Whilst the room was not huge, it was more than adequate and was clean. In addition to expected furnishings the room contained a television, safe, refrigerator, air conditioning and double glazing. There was also a private bathroom with excellent shower. The hotel does not have a huge sign outside so you need to find it by it's address, we had a GPS so it was easy. Reception closes at 20.00 so you need to check in before that time and take the front door key with you when you go out. You are expected to pay in full for your stay at check in which we found to be fairly common for budget hotels in Italy. Breakfast is provided in a small pleasant cafe next door to the hotel every day except Sundays and holidays and comprises of Juice toast and preserves and a drink of your choice. It is simple but adequate and extra toast was always offered. The hotel has a lovely terrace wher you can sit and relax with a glass of wine. The hotel does not have a bar but they have no objection to you taking in your own drinks and will provide glasses if you ask. The real plus point of this hotel is it's location which is in Trastevere near a huge choice of restaurant and within about a 20 min. walk of most major tourist sites and with good public transport nearby. The reception staff spoke excellent English and were happy to provide helpfull information when asked. All in all, a good budget choice in an area wher hotels accomodation is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Kosher at the Carmel Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Carmel because it offers a Kosher breakfast. While true, breakfast was disappointing and many days we gave it a miss, since, in any case, we preferred an early start. On the Sabbath they provide a hot platter and electric urn which were welcome. The rooms were adequate for people who do not intend spending much time in their rooms and the location is good. We think the reviewer who couldn't find it is being unreasonable: it is very well serviced by the local transport and made sight-seeing both in Rome and by train to other cities very easy. It is also an easy walk to the Jewish quarter and kosher restaurants as well as to the Vatican and to the Pantheon and Colliseum. The staff were helpful (not only Marcello); and if looking for a budget hotel in Rome I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay The Hell Away”
Reviews.Author: babu707
Reviews.Content: After taking train, trum and lots of walking, we found the place. No one seemed to know such a hotel exists even when we were a block away. It's very hard to see the hotel name. The lady at the desk asked for the full payment even before we got a chance to look at the room. First time in Rome and it was raining so we're like in no choice situation. We're shocked when we saw the room. It was about 12 by 8 feet, little bigger than my bathroom in New Jersey. Once enterd, no room to walk around. The bathroom was the Tiniest one you can imagine and not seen before. The bathroom had no door but had a curtain. My 170 lbs body couldn't fit in for a shower. Due to the fear of smell, we tried to use the toilet down the hallway, which was always occupied, you know why. There was a very old 12 inch TV with a broken remote control. Don't give up, keep pressing the remote control buttons and evantually you'll be switched another Italian channel. There was no English channel, in case you want to check the weather report. The paint was coming off the wall and there was an odor in the room. The bed was damp and very hard. My advise is do not jump into bed at Carmel. They could probably replcae the mattress with a couple of nights pay but didn't. What a shame. The place is on the second floor of an old building by a busy street, so it was very noisy round the clock, we had to buy ear cap in order to sleep. It's no where near any attraction; the closest one is 25 minutes away. The door closes at 8:00 PM, therefore, never forget the key or you'll be sleeping on the street. Checkout time is 11:00 AM sharp. The breakfast was a joke. You get two toasts, water and tea or coffee, which can't cost you more than two bucks in Rome. After the first day we never bothered to go back for the breakfast. It's about 20 minutes away from Trastevere restaurant and bar zone. The lady at the desk at the time of arrival was very cold, she only seemed to be interested to get the full payment ASAP. Marcelo was the only guy who seemed to be nice. Stay way from paying 100 Euro for such a nasty palce. There's no way such a room can be worth of 100 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful terrace garden”
Reviews.Author: Septemberhoneymooner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carmel was the first of five hotels that we stayed in whilst on our honeymoon in Italy. It was the least expensive pensione of our trip and exceeded our expectations. The map in Rome's Lonely Planet led us to believe that it was further out of Trestavere that it actually is - less than a two minute walk to the cafe filled streets and a pleasant walk over the bridge to the centre of Rome and all of the sights. We requested the room that opens onto the pretty terrace garden. The room was huge with sound proof glass on the windows which ensured a good nights sleep. Value for money, helpful staff and clean, spacious rooms - all reasons why we will be returning to Hotel Carmel.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. located 20 min from the center by walking. the stuff is very friendly and informative. thats a good choice for rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place staff lacking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers clean rooms of various sizes. You may want to find out if you are on the street or in a back room. There is a room that opens onto the nice terrace that would probably be worth asking for. They have small refrigerators in each room but in one room it was not working. It's a good location, able to walk to major attractions. The breakfast in the cafe next door is wonderful and the people there were very friendly. I was a little disappointed with the hotel staff. Some of the staff in the hotel did not know the local area and didn't try to be very helpful. The nearby restaurants and squares are lively into the evening which was fun. Always felt safe walking around the area and even though we were on the street side, the windows were insulated so the noise did not keep us awake. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: DanaCH
Reviews.Content: For a small "locanda", this is definitely a great hotel for the money. The rooms were quite nice and a little larger than the typical room in europe. The bathrooms looked recently renovated and worked well. The staff was always very helpful and nice and spoke english very well. The hotel also has a large garden-terrace overlooking the small and somewhat stylish street the hotel is located on, just on the edge of Trastevere (one of my favorite areas of Rome). Their largest room opens directly onto the terrace and is only 10euro more than the other rooms. We would stay here again in a second.
